name: Zac Poonen
description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

audio_sermons.title: (Atlanta 2013) 5. The Church - The Pillar of Truth
audio_sermons.description: Brother Zac shares about New Covenant Churches that hold the truth and mystery of the Gospel. These truths only come through revelation from the Holy Spirit from God. There is a great difference to build a Church simply on good ideas and fellowship or on revelation from God. He explains on the body of Christ work in local bodies a fellowship where there is life.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

audio_sermons.title: (Disciples Of Jesus) True Discipleship
audio_sermons.description: Zac Poonen shares his heart plainly at a christian conference. He speaks on true discipleship and those that follow Christ and don't gather men and honor to themselves. This message is throbbing with love and unselfish desire yet has a strong rebuke and correction for many in ministry. May God allow this message to be a balm to many before that great day before God in heaven where all things will be made bare.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: Tremendous lessons and warnings can be extracted from these opening verses of the Bible.  Zac Poonen labors in the Word of God to illustrate the fall of Lucifer (Satan) as a warning to believers of the consequences of having the same spirit of "I will go up."  The work of transformation upon the earth without form and void holds precious truths for followers of Jesus as to how to be transformed into His image and likeness!

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 10
audio_sermons.description: The three arks of Scripture typify God's protection from death.  As Noah built an ark, what priority do we give to the only thing that will last after the world is destroyed, namely the Church?  The raven and the dove are pictures of the flesh and the Spirit that show what our true spiritual condition is.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 11
audio_sermons.description: Have you seen the death of Jesus in the covenant of Noah's rainbow?  Brother Zac shows the safety of pressures and persecutions such as Noah faced for 120 years; his fall came in the time of ease.  We can learn from the curse of Ham to put to death this evil curiosity to see the nakedness of others, which manifests itself in many ways.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 12
audio_sermons.description: What does Nimrod, the first king, warn us about in our spiritual lives today?  Brother Zac uncovers the spirit of Babylon--making plans without any consideration of God's will and desiring to rule and dominate others through soul power or money power.  "The greatest delusion of all," he warns, "is having the language of Jerusalem with the spirit of Nimrod."

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 13
audio_sermons.description: God is still looking for people like Abraham today who have a responsive heart.  The blessing of Abraham--the baptism in the Holy Spirit--can make us a blessing to every family that we meet.  Abraham's mistakes serve a sober warning to us that missing God's will that it may go well with us have serious and long lasting consequences long after God has forgiven us of the sin.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 14
audio_sermons.description: The contrast between Abraham and Lot is a contrast between believers today.  Lot is a picture of a righteous man but one who chooses for himself, not trusting God to choose for him.  Melchizedek's coming on the scene into Abraham's life is a picture of the New Covenant priesthood of blessing others.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 15
audio_sermons.description: Melchizedek teaches us that we don't always bless by giving big sermons; two or three appropriate sentences can be all it takes to stir up faith in someone else.  One revelation from God protected Abraham from the temptations from the king of Sodom.  Faith is hearing God's promise to you and "amening" that as Abraham did.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 16
audio_sermons.description: The birth of Ishmael is a picture of doing things for God but not after God's way.  What we first call victory over sin is only an Ishmael, our own efforts under law.  When we come to our wits end and are broken like Abraham, then we can be a prince with God.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 17
audio_sermons.description: Abraham was a man God picked out because he was quick to obey clear revelation and showed hospitality and true humility as a servant.  He also was careful to raise up a family in God-fearing ways.  This first recorded intercessory prayer reveals that God's ear is open to one righteous life.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 18
audio_sermons.description: Lot lost his testimony in Sodom because it is our life that makes our testimony effective.  A true disciple is one who is not attached to anything in this world.  Abraham's lapse in Gerar is a warning that following great experiences or revelation from God to be very careful.  In our judgments of others we need to also be careful, for we may have judged Abraham a liar but God called him a prophet.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 19
audio_sermons.description: The birth of Isaac came at the end of Abraham and Sarah laying hold of God by faith despite their ups and downs.  Isaac and Isaac contrast believers under the old covenant (done in the strength of the flesh) and those of the new covenant, that which is done supernaturally.  God's tests come to see whether He is first in our life.  Abraham went against human reason, counted the cost, and obeyed God in offering Isaac, the first mention of worship and also a picture of the resurrection.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 2
audio_sermons.description: Have you considered the numerous references to God separating in the work of creation and what that means in principle for the Christian life?  Brother Zac shows the importance of separating the darkness of human traditions and worldliness from the light of God's revealed word in Christ.  What warning can we take heed to in that man and the animals were made on the same day?

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 20
audio_sermons.description: The test that Abraham passed in offering up Isaac is whether he feared God or not.  We face this same test not in the areas we obey so easily but in immediate obedience in the things God speaks to our hearts in secret.  Our worship is not measured by our correct doctrine or what songs we sing but whether we give to God that which costs us something; it's our attitude towards God that matters most.

audio_sermons.description: Brother Zac points out many principles for young people to trust God about a life's partner as well as pointing out Abraham's servant as a type of the Holy Spirit seeking a bride for Jesus.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 22
audio_sermons.description: What Abraham gave to Isaac was not a doctrine but a living faith.  The struggle of Jacob and Esau in the womb depicts the struggle in the believer between flesh and spirit.  God's sovereign choice of Jacob was not according to works, which has principles of rest for us, such as being delivered from competition and jealousy over ministry with others in the church.  Isaac's partiality at age 80 is a warning to be steadfast to the spiritual zeal of younger years.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 23
audio_sermons.description: The end of Isaac's life is summed up by the words, "His eyes grew dim."  The young man who spent his time meditating in the fields and praying for the birth of sons lost his spiritual discernment by loving food more than the will of God and lacking struggles in life because everything was handed to him.  Rebecca also serves as a warning to sisters who begin to think of themselves as the wife of no ordinary person and end up losing out.  This section contains much profitable counsel for parents in raising up godly children.

audio_sermons.description: The vision of Jacob's ladder is shown to be the Lord Jesus in John 1, which pictures our Mediator as one who came all the way down to earth, on our level as a man.  God used a difficult employer (Laban) and two difficult wives (Leah and Rachel) to discipline and humble Jacob.  As believers, we need to have our eyes opened to see this Jacob in our flesh that God may deliver us.

audio_sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 26
audio_sermons.description: Jacob's detour to Shechem shows us how important it is to be wholehearted and radical and how this transformation process can be.  In Shechem, Jacob ran into many problems, losing authority in the home and his daughters wandering the streets.  Esau's having kings long before Jacob's teaches that affliction is the true preparation for kingship.  Joseph serves as a challenge to have a heart open to God and also as a tremendous picture of Jesus Christ.

audio_sermons.description: Judah's backsliding and adultery with his daughter-in-law Tamar holds out warnings of ungodly association but also the mercy of God through Jesus' willingness to be identified with sinners.  The tests of Joseph are the tests for every believer: submission to spiritual authority and keeping oneself pure.  The "post-graduate" tests come when we can stand up under false accusation and suffer for the sins of others.

The naming of Joseph's two sons illustrates that before we can be fruitful, we must forget all the evil and mistakes of others.

One faithful man can accomplish a tremendous lot for God!

audio_sermons.description: God gave Adam two gardens to tend and guard: a natural one and a spiritual one with his wife. The good news is that behind every command of Jesus is the grace and power to do it!

audio_sermons.title: (God Can Solve Every Problem) Water turned into wine
audio_sermons.description: Zac Poonen begins this 8-part series analyzing the spiritual message and purpose behind the Lord's miracle of the water turned into wine. Zac draws several wonderful contrasts in the Christian life--law and grace, coworkers with God and slothful servants, self-satisfaction and neediness, the Spirit's anointing and a dried up life.

audio_sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 1 - A Loving Father
audio_sermons.description: All of our problems arise from our lack of awareness of God as our Father.  What revolutionizes my life is knowing that the Father loves me as much as He loves Jesus!  The quality of life described in the new covenant is distinctively better than that of the old covenant, as high as Jesus is above Moses.  Living in the superior provision of the new covenant is having a Father as Jesus did, not a policeman full of rules and regulations.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. audio_sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 2 - All-Sufficient Grace
audio_sermons.description: "Grace is God's power to help us, to see us through every need we could ever face in our life," Zac Poonen proclaims.  Do you find yourself continually defeated by a sin--anger, lust, dirty thoughts?  You need not live a substandard Christian life but can freely enter into what God has promised of His all-sufficient grace that is more than a match for whatever your need or difficulty is!
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)

audio_sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 3 - A Life of Faith
audio_sermons.description: "To walk by faith is as much superior to walking by sight as Jesus is higher than Moses," says brother Zac.  In the new covenant we have a better life of faith like Jesus, who overcame all sin and pleased the Father from morning until night.  The root causes of failure to walk by faith are in seeing faith as something in ourselves or working hard to obtain what only God can do.  Zac shares how he tried every doctrine of holiness and failed miserably until he came to see the simplicity of biblical faith--leaning of the human personality in total confidence in God's perfect love for me.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)

audio_sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 4 - The Spirit's Fullness
audio_sermons.description: God sent the Holy Spirit first to set us free from sin on the inside, something which the law could never do.  The Spirit comes to bring those that thirst the same life and power that was exhibited in Jesus Christ.  Are rivers of living water flowing from you or just trickles?  Brother Zac shares from God's Word how the Spirit's fullness is something for every believer.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:

audio_sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 5 - Satan Defeated
audio_sermons.description: One way to tell if you are still living under the old covenant is whether you still fight with human beings.  When Satan was defeated on the cross, believers now war against the real enemy which even the greatest saints of the old covenant could never do.  Beware of certain sins that can bring you into fellowship with the devil, such as pride, lying and anger.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

audio_sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 6 - Fellowship in One Body
audio_sermons.description: Personal holiness must lead to being built together with others into one body, otherwise it's a deception.  It's not the brothers and sisters of faraway lands that perfects holiness in us, but the one in our local assembly that irritates us or rubs us the wrong way.  Each little church must be an expression of Christ's body, which blends people who are totally different in one by the power of the Holy Spirit.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

audio_sermons.title: (The Power of the Holy Spirit - 1) The Breath of God
audio_sermons.description: Many Christians today live a life under the law, like rowing a boat requiring a lot of effort, but life in the Holy Spirit is like a sailing boat empowered by a mighty wind.  Brother Zac shows what a glorious life is available to every believer made possible by another Helper who is exactly like the first Helper--Jesus.  In a day when there is so many counterfeits and so much confusion about the Holy Spirit, Zac shows what God's Word says we should expect when He breathes upon us.

audio_sermons.title: (The Power of the Holy Spirit - 2) Rivers of Living Water
audio_sermons.description: Jesus came with something more wonderful than laws--rivers of Living Water!  Can someone else turn off your joy?  Then you need to receive the well of water Jesus promised.  Brother Zac shares how the Holy Spirit is not an optional extra to the Christian life but the key to LIFE in Christ Jesus and being a blessing to other people in many directions.

audio_sermons.title: (The Power of the Holy Spirit - 3) The Fire of God
audio_sermons.description: Jesus came to set people on fire for God, a fire of the Holy Spirit that brings inner purity and holiness.  "Holiness is to your soul," Zac says, "what health is to your body."  The sermon is lined with encouragements and warnings, especially glorying in correct doctrine without fire--God's presence--and lukewarmness, which is detestable in God's sight.  "We are not just called to go to heaven; we're called to be a flaming witness for Jesus Christ on this earth."

audio_sermons.title: (The Real Jesus) 1 Jesus Did Not Seek His Own
audio_sermons.description: This message by Poonen really will open your eyes to what type of Jesus you have been hearing and serving. You have to honestly ask yourself do you know the Real Jesus? Have you allowed Him to transform and change your life? This is going to be the Real Jesus and it is unfortunate that we have to speak about that because God never intended that there should ever be any other Jesus presented to this world than the real one. Everything valuable has been counterfeited, people don't counterfeit things that are not valuable. Even in the times of the apostles we read of Jesus being counterfeited. So I want to turn first of all to 2 Corinthians chapter 11 so you'll see that it is not a problem of the 21st century. It was there right from the beginning.

audio_sermons.title: (The Real Jesus) 5 Jesus Overcame In Weakness
audio_sermons.description: The secret of the Christian life is to be weak like Jesus, not seeking His own and trusting the Father.  Brother Zac shares a number of areas in our walk with the Lord, such as coming out from legalism and traditions not in the Bible, not leaning upon zealous believers so as to not develop an individual life with God, and taking caution not to be critical against others and subtly end up holding hands with the accuser of the brethren, the devil.

audio_sermons.title: (matthew) Ch.27:32-28:20
audio_sermons.description: There is bearing the cross that is one of compulsion (like the Roman soldiers did to Simon of Syrene) and the cross of Jesus--something we choose voluntarily.  We see the sovereignty of God working in Jesus' friends (like Joseph of Arimathea) and enemies (Pilate and the chief priests), all to bear strong witness to the resurrection.  We see angels who cannot tell the disciples and the chief priests who cannot tell the truth.  All are instructive truths to live by.  In the Great Commission, the emphasis is on making disciples.  Brother Zac warns against being moved by tremendous need in the world without looking at God.

audio_sermons.title: Balance Of Truth - 1
audio_sermons.description: Much error that comes into Christianity is not because people teach error but because one truth is magnified so much at the expense of another truth.  Zac Poonen concentrates on six areas where we need to be balanced, the first two expounded in this sermon: 1) faith and works, and 2) love for God and love for man.

audio_sermons.description: Two more vital areas of balance in the Christian life are: 3) truth and grace, and 4) fruit and gifts of the Holy Spirit.  Brother Zac strikes at the heart of these areas working together to grow up more and more into a perfectly balanced human being as Jesus was.

audio_sermons.title: Balance Of Truth - 3
audio_sermons.description: If we mix up the biblical priorities between our personal life and our church life--the Lord Jesus, then family, then church/ministry--we will go astray.  Brother Zac encourages seeking to build fellowship with radical, wholehearted disciples while being available to serve others.  What about the right emphasis on evangelism and discipleship making?  Gain practical insight in these areas that often trip people up in their Christian walk!

audio_sermons.title: Don't Break God's Heart
audio_sermons.description: What a tradegy that many of God's people are missing their birthright, inheritance and what Christ secured on us for the cross. This breaks God's heart in our day.

audio_sermons.title: Eight Ways Of Deceiving Ourselves

audio_sermons.title: Everything Outside Of Christ Is Rubbish
audio_sermons.description: Paul had a deep experience with Christ because he didn't put value on what everybody else valued.  Brother Zac uncovers the spirit of being a servant that deals with God in terms of transactions rather than coming to Him as a loving Father.  This spills over into our relationships with others, such as when we think of ourselves as "senior brother" or "senior sister" and make legalistic demands upon others.

audio_sermons.title: Freedom From Denominationalism
audio_sermons.description: Denominationalism is a prison for many and the spirit of this many need to be freed from. This sermon points out how the denominational spirit is the same that impelled the Pharisee's to emphasize their spiritual purity due to their Abrahamic pedigree. Brother Zac makes a strong case for the building of local bodies that are not connected through denominational structures that have leadership that use and abuse the sheep, but are overseen by truly spiritual brothers.

audio_sermons.title: Freedom From Fear
audio_sermons.description: In his inimitable fashion, Brother Zac shares practical wisdom concerning the difference between fear and caution a.k.a. wisdom. He explains the importance of funneling all decisions through the filter of faith instead of the slavery of fear. He also lambastes men who act effeminate through fear.
audio_sermons.preacher_description:

audio_sermons.title: Freedom From Legalism
audio_sermons.description: A church filled with all sorts of extra-biblical rules is like a cup that will be clean on the outside, but inside it will be filled with dead men's bones.  Brethren can determine if they are legalists by analyzing whether there is a disparity between their church life, and their private life.  Just like Moses had to hide his face so people could not see God's glory fading, legalists will have to hide parts of their lives from others.  The solution?  The life and the liberty of the Spirit!  The ultimate test of a legalist: "Do you love rules more than you love people, or do you love people more than you love rules?"
audio_sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. audio_sermons.title: Freedom From Self-Centeredness
audio_sermons.description: In order to walk in victory over self-centeredness, we must reckon this flesh to have been crucified with Christ on the cross.  If we are living with the sole purpose of chasing after worldly things like food, clothing, a good comfortable life, popularity or advancement, we have not accepted that Jesus died for these things. Brother Zac points out in this sermon how salvation is completely free, but there are things in Christianity that will cost us.  Can you be so lost in ministry that you lose a meal? Suffer persecution?  While emphasizing that we must be victorious in these areas we are encouraged to accept the concept of steady progress over these sins as is shown to be a thematic of New Covenant faith.

audio_sermons.title: Freedom From Sin
audio_sermons.description: There is a direct connection between understanding the deepest sufferings of Christ, and an abiding hatred for sin.  We cannot limit Jesus suffering to mere physical suffering, otherwise sin could be dealt with and atoned for with every human death, and that would be sufficient for entrance into heaven.  With a true understanding and acknowledgment of the spiritual and infinite sufferings of Christ should also come a truth which breaks us free from our love of sin.  If we only ever see God as a means to our physical need, then we are missing the point of the New Covenant entirely.  Brother Poonen also ties a heavy rock to the idea that Jesus suffered in Hell for three days while dead, and casts it into the deepest sea.

audio_sermons.title: Freedom From Soulishness
audio_sermons.description: Beginning with an explanation that soulishness is a topic many may not understand until later in their Christian walk, this sermon explains the dynamic of allowing biblical truth to hit the bedrock of the Christian’s will as opposed to the sandier extremes of dry intellect or meaningless emotionalism.   He offers a balanced view on how to determine what soulishness is, and says that we must learn to allow the sword of the spirit to divide that which is of the soul from that which is of the Spirit, in order that we may fly out of this snare.

audio_sermons.title: Freedom From This World System
audio_sermons.description: There is a distinction between “loving the world” and not being “of the world,” that believers must make.  We are not called to hide from the world, but rather we are to be in it while being completely freed from its clutches, and free from its systemic tyranny over our lives.  This sermon shows how, if you use worldly methods to attract people to your fellowships, worldly people are all you will attract.  Brother Zac uses a flurry of scriptures to blow away any notion that it is acceptable to God to still be of this present evil world.

audio_sermons.description: Zac mines the riches from Luke's Gospel, homing in the particular emphases such as being filled with the Holy Spirit and building the body of Christ. From Jesus' early life and ministry we learn such useful examples as getting to know God's word, having a passion for the Father's business, and getting alone with Him.

audio_sermons.title: Malachi
audio_sermons.description: The last book of the Old Testament enlarges upon the desired qualities of leaders, such as fearing God, living uprightly, and turning people from sin.  Emphases in the book are the quality of what we offer to God, not the quantity, faithfulness in marriage relations, and raising a godly seed.  The Old Testament ends with a curse that will be lifted when Christ comes.

audio_sermons.title: Mark
audio_sermons.description: Zac draws attention to a wide variety of precious truths that shape a disciple being made after the likeness of Jesus.  Hindrances include trying to make yourself into what God can only do, living under the law, asceticism, valuing human traditions more than God's Word, and setting you mind upon your own gain.  Our encouragements are to receive the new wine--the life of Jesus--and come to know Jesus through the Scriptures.

audio_sermons.title: Nehemiah, Esther
audio_sermons.description: Nehemiah teaches us that God is waiting for one man who has a burden for the glory of God.  One who fears God will be fearless towards men and strict about God's standards.  The believers who stayed behind in Babylon in the book of Esther pictures a corrupt Christianity of people who live after the flesh.  Yet God still cares and provides for such people, though He doesn't publicly identify with them as He did with those who live selflessly for Christ.

audio_sermons.title: Religiosity or Spirituality #1 - Hungering for More of God
audio_sermons.description: Zac Poonen found that so many Christians are living a substandard life, but it doesn't have to be this way.  Brother Zac stirs you to go beyond being satisfied with so little, when God has promised rivers of living water to flow out of you to be a blessing to everyone you meet.  "If you're satisfied with something less than God's highest, then that's all you'll have."

audio_sermons.title: Religiosity or Spirituality #2 - The Two Streams
audio_sermons.description: When Adam fell, he not only gained a gravitation towards sin but also towards being religious.  Brother Zac contrasts these two streams--religiosity vs. spirituality--as it threads its way through the Bible, starting with Cain and Abel, to the Pharisees and Jesus, to the end times in Revelation with Babylon and Jerusalem.  Externally these can appear so similar, but the underlying spirit is as different as heaven is from hell.

audio_sermons.title: Religiosity or Spirituality - Life and Laws
audio_sermons.description: Do you know how to recognize when you are truly spiritual or just merely religious? What does it really mean for our self life to be crucified?

audio_sermons.title: Religiosity or Spirituality - Listening to the Spirit
audio_sermons.description: "The Christian life," says Zac Poonen, "is not following a code of conduct; it's following a Person."  Brother Zac explains many failures in the Christian life that come by "doing something for the Lord" without waiting upon Him and obeying the little promptings of the Holy Spirit.  "When you listen to God and do what He says, you can do more in six months than in sixty years of trying to do something on your own."

audio_sermons.title: Seeking God With All Our Heart
audio_sermons.description: Brother Zac Poonen shares about seeking God and how many things can hinder finding fellowship with the Lord. He shares on the sabbath rest and how God prescribed a rest so that God could be put first. In the same way in the New Covenant we are to give our first to the Lord amidst the distractions and allures of this world. One chief underlying factor of not seeking the Lord is greed for money and covetousness of which the children of Israel fell into time and time again instead of seeking the Lord first.

audio_sermons.title: Spirit Filled Family
audio_sermons.description: Is your home a little foretaste of heaven on earth?  That's what the Holy Spirit has come to do--to bring the atmosphere of heaven!  Have you ever considered that a Spirit-filled husband and a Spirit-filled wife is unique to New Testament times and what that means?  Are you seeking practical help from God's Word to mold and shape your family to be pleasing to your beloved Savior Jesus Christ?  Zac Poonen shares a wealth of practical insight on family life, such as submission, honor, hypocritical motives, tests for tension, and many more!  (85 min.)

audio_sermons.description: "One of the byproducts of knowing God as Father was it delivered me from competition with other believers," speaks brother Zac.  Knowing God as Father is one of his favorite subjects, never tiring to share how much liberty comes in the Christian life, assurance that truly all things work together for good, and the deliverance from counterfeit holiness that comes from the fear of man.

audio_sermons.title: The Call Of God - The Call To Holiness

audio_sermons.title: The Danger Of Pharisaism
audio_sermons.description: Brother Zac looks at the very dangerous imbalance of holiness preaching taken to a extreme. This message serves as a gentle warning in love to many who have strong convictions that go past what God calls and leads. We need zealous strong individuals that display the compassion of God but a unyielding desire for truth. The true body of Christ should fulfill the same function as Jesus did while on earth--exposing unreality and religious hypocrisy.  As Zac has studied many groups in Christendom that majored on holiness, all of their mistakes could be summed up in one thing: pharisaism.  Many precious principles are put forth that we may ask the question: "Am I really presenting Christ correctly?"

audio_sermons.title: The Principles By Which Jesus Lived

audio_sermons.title: The Secret Of Devotion
audio_sermons.description: When Christians find themselves gravitating to the world, it is because they have not yet found a satisfying life in Christ.  Have you experienced the "expulsive power of a new affection"?  Brother Zac shares ways to kindle a true hunger for Christ by meditating on how much He suffered for you on the cross, getting into fellowship with those who have a fervent love for Jesus, giving up whatever takes away your hunger for God, and others.

audio_sermons.title: The Shadow And The Reality
audio_sermons.description: Many Christians today get so preoccupied with the shadow--the law--that they miss the Person--Jesus Christ.  Zac Poonen shares three things stressed by the law--the Sabbath, tithing and circumcision--and what the reality of these are to be in the Christian life under grace.  You may be surprised to learn how much deception goes on in Christendom because of Bible verses taken out of their proper context.

audio_sermons.title: The Terms Of The New Convenant
audio_sermons.description: Zac teaches three fundamental truths about the new covenant as it is explained in Hebrews 8.  The new covenant begins with an assurance that our sins have been cleansed away, not just covered, coupled with a warning about the sin of unforgiveness.  Secondly, we can know Him personally as our Father, in living connection with Him all the day, both speaking and listening.  And finally, God writes upon the two tablets--the mind and the heart--to not only be willing but the grace as God's power to do it.

audio_sermons.title: The Way of the Cross
audio_sermons.description:
If Jesus needed to pray, how much more His followers? Zac Poonen takes us to the cross and along the way delves into the areas of our sacrifice, surrender and suffering in secret.
Many scripture refrences; Luke 3:2,22, Romans 8:36, 1 Cor 7, Heb 5:7, Rev 4, 2 Sam 24, Is 53:2,10 to name a few. A lot of ground covered in this thought provoking message.

audio_sermons.title: The Word In A Recession

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - 1 Kings
audio_sermons.description: Zac Poonen shows how God's great need for our day is leaders and prophets.  Leaders must have discernment, transparency, boldness, a good conscience, and humility.  We can learn to take heed to the many warnings from the lives of great men like David, Solomon, Elijah and others.    Imagine a book that begins with David and ends with Ahab!  The book of Kings shows how important God's leaders affect the spiritual state of God's people.  What could have been the result in Solomon's life had David last words been about marriage and godly leadership rather than revenge?  Solomon teaches us about spiritual discernment and misdirected energies that end in destruction.  Elijah gives various insights into the boldness that comes from God's presence and looking away from crows to God alone in spite of human weaknesses and frailties.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - 1 Samuel
audio_sermons.description: We need to learn both from the warnings from bad examples (Eli, Saul) and the challenges from good examples (Samuel, Jonathan, David).  Saul started off a humble and faithful young man with God and God's anointing and lost the kingdom through lack of heart devotion to the Lord.  David's concern for the little lambs, a heart of worship, and difficulties he experienced made him a good king.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - 1&2 Chronicles, Ezra
audio_sermons.description: Zac picks up on truths in the Chronicles that were not covered already in the parallel accounts of 1 & 2 Kings.  Men of God are shaped by suffering and pain (Jabez), the anointing (Amasai), supporting others in ministry (David), listening to God (Micaiah), and seriously studying God's Word (Ezra).  The lives of King Uzziah and King Hezekiah warn us about being puffed up with spiritual pride.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - 2 Kings
audio_sermons.description: 2 Kings begins with Elijah going to heaven and the people of God going to captivity in Babylon.  Zac keys off many lessons a wise person can take heed from such as Elisha's faithfulness and pursuit of God's best and the humility worked in Namaan the leper.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - 2 Samuel
audio_sermons.description: Description: The book of 2 Samuel picks up on the reign of King David.  Zac homes in on David's godly habits (inquiring of the Lord), godly heart (build God's house), godly understanding (God's sovereignty that caused him to rest), as well as failures we can learn from (too many wives, taking ease at the wrong time).  "The trials God takes us through," he encourages, "are by which God gives you a ministry."

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Colossians
audio_sermons.description: The marks of a spiritual church are looking at everything from God's point of view.  We are like Christ in suffering in that we don't gain but many others around us do.  This book has great exhortations to cling to the reality--Christ the Head--and not shadows or photographs or even the messengers of Christendom.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Deuteronomy
audio_sermons.description: Deuteronomy has three messages that make us look in different directions: look back at God's faithfulness, look up at Jesus, and look forward.  This repetition of the law reinforces God's heart in many areas, such as obedience in small commandments, requirements for spiritual leaders, dangers of prosperity and false prophets.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Ecclesiastes
audio_sermons.description: Whereas Proverbs demonstrates the divine wisdom, Ecclesiastes demonstrates human wisdom of a man who lives beneath the sun.  The book shows the character of a religious man not led by the Holy Spirit--worldly thinking gets mixed up with spiritual wisdom.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Genesis - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: Studying the Bible is not a quest for knowledge but life--to know what God would say to me.  The creation pictures several foundational principles of Christian living: remaking ruined humanity, separating light from darkness, and overcoming.  We also see the two streams running throughout the Bible--Babylon and Jerusalem--starting with two men who listened to the devil (Adam and Cain) and two men who walked with God (Enoch and Noah).

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Genesis - Part 2
audio_sermons.description: A lot in Genesis is fundamental in our understanding of God, likened to a seed from which out comes everything later on.  Genesis 10 & 11 highlight the beginnings of Babylon, a religious and monetary system that falsely promises to show you the gate to God.  Abraham is God's beginning of Jerusalem, a man of faith who learned to live by the words from God's mouth.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Genesis - Part 3
audio_sermons.description: Zac keys on the characteristics of a godly man as seen in Isaac, Jacob and Joseph, such as blessing one's enemies, laying hold of God, and refusing to complain against people who have done you wrong.  In God's sovereignty, He even makes the jealousy of others work for you, as He did with Joseph.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Hebrews - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: Because Jesus is God we worship Him, but what practical implications does Jesus as man have for us?  Although a sincere and earnest Christian and full-time ministry worker, brother Zac was utterly defeated in his inner life, home life and ministry until God opened His eyes from Hebrews 2 to see Jesus was a man just like him--and his life was never the same again!  Beware of thinking God is happy with you because you experience miracles; God's pleasure is when you enter Canaan and put the giants of anger and lust under your feet.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Isaiah - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: Isaiah neatly divides into two halves (chapters 1 - 39 and 40 - 66).  The key chapter in the first half is chapter 6, which emphasizes God's throne and sovereignty.  The great conflicts arise with proud people, self-righteousness and types of Christ and Antichrist.

audio_sermons.description: The Holy Spirit is one of the main themes of Isaiah 40 - 66, as is in the New Testament.  Zac pulls out various encouragements and warnings, such as a carefulness never to take God's glory, promises for parents, and the heart of the lowly as one the places God lives.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Jeremiah & Lamentations
audio_sermons.description: Jeremiah is strikingly similar to Jesus as one simple of heart, sensitive to God and others, strong in proclaiming the truth, and steadfast to the end.  The message of the prophet cried against superficiality of religious externalism.  In Lamentations, Jeremiah sang a funeral song for Jerusalem, a weeping that identified with the people.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Job - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: The book of Job is most likely the first Scripture written in the Bible, and it centers upon what God is looking for: a godly man.  As the book deals with the problem of suffering, we see what is actually happening in the heavenly realm.  Zac shows how a true godly man will be misunderstood, experience loneliness and have a pathway of suffering, yet enjoys God's protection (the hedge), freedom from seeking men's honor and is a worshipper.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Job - Part 2
audio_sermons.description: In this insightful lesson, Zac shows the four types of preachers today in Christendom.  Can you see yourself in Zophar, the self-appointed prophet, or Eliphaz, the one who tries to lend weight to his words by supernatural happenings, or Elihu, the man with the right knowledge by no experience of deep suffering?  The fifth preacher, who brought Job to repentance, was God, who loved him and that was what made all the difference.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - John - Part 1
audio_sermons.description: John chapter 1 is rich with contrasts--grace and truth, come and hear vs. come and see, doctrine vs. life.  "It's real life," Zac explains, "when we're out there in the world and we manifest the beauty and the humility and the patience of Jesus Christ to an ungodly and selfish world."  In each miracle is a parable (a spiritual message), such as the lame man at Bethesda who pictured life under the law.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - John - Part 2
audio_sermons.description: Zac finishes up John's gospel, drawing our attention to keynote truths, such as coming to zero point, Christian service, fruit through death to self, and many others.  The only mark of God's blessing on you is that you're becoming more and more like Jesus Christ in your character.  The identifying mark of God's people is loving one another, not gifts or doctrine.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Joshua
audio_sermons.description: Overcoming sin through the Lord Jesus, our Joshua, is the theme of this book.  The "old man" has already been killed by God (i.e. Pharoah's army), but the lusts of our flesh (i.e., giants in Canaan) must be killed one by one if we are to enter in and possess the land.  Great victories come because God is with me, hearing what God is saying, avoiding the temptation to be complacent, and many others.

audio_sermons.title: Through The Bible - Zechariah
audio_sermons.description: Zac unpacks the eight visions of Zechariah showing God's heart for the Church, the ministry of God the Father, God the Son and God the Holy Spirit, and subtle areas to be on guard for.  The last chapters home in on Jesus as the Messiah and ending with a purging of the Church from the moneymaking self-centeredness of Babylon.

He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

audio_sermons.title: You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan
audio_sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.
